p: Poyiadji et al. reported the first presumptive case of COVID-19-associated acute necrotizing hemorrhagic encephalopathy [ 26]. Acute necrotizing encephalopathy is a rare encephalopathy and one of the remote complications of influenza and other viral infections. This has been presumed to be due to intracranial cytokine storm, which results in the bloodâ€“brain barrier breakdown, without direct viral invasion or para-infectious demyelination [ 27]. Accumulating evidence suggests that a subgroup of patients with severe COVID-19 might have a cytokine storm syndrome [ 28].
